descript.abstract: Street Centerlines (centerline of Rights of Way) for Wake County
descript.purpose: These data were created to assist governmental agencies and others in making resource management decisions through use of a Geographic Information System (GIS).

sngdate.caldate: REQUIRED: The year (and optionally month, or month and day) for which the data set corresponds to the ground.

place.placekt: William S. Powell, The North Carolina GAZETTEER, A Dictionary of Tar Heel Places, (Chapel Hill: University of North Carolina Press), August 1984.

idinfo.useconst: Wake County Geographic Information Services shall not be held liable for any errors in these data. This includes errors of omission, commission, errors concerning the content of the data, and relative and positional accuracy of the data. These data cannot be construed to be a legal document. Primary sources from which these data were compiled must be consulted for verification of information contained in these data.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.780

attracc.attraccr: The attribute data varies in accuracy, although every effort has been made to correct errors where possible. Street names are checked against the County's master street dictionary and most misspellings and errors have been corrected. Street types have been standardized across the County. Address information varies in accuracy depending on the source. Address information from registered deeds and plats is highly accurate. Address information in rural and outlying areas is less accurate as it is derived from maps produced in 1988 when rural addresses were converted from rural route and box number to city-style addresses. Efforts have been made to correct the errors as resources have permitted, but the user of this information should obtain independent verification of all address data.

dataqual.logic: Topological Validation on data set will be done beginning in Summer 2006.
dataqual.complete: All public and private streets in Wake County that can be determined from recorded road rights-of-way are included; new streets are added within 30 days of plat recordation

horizpa.horizpar: This dataset is based on Wake County's cadastral database. The original cadastral database delivered by the conversion vendor was compiled according to the "Technical Specifications for Base, Cadastral and Digital Mapping" (NC Land Records Management Program, NC Attorney General's Office) For updates, information from deeds and plats is digitized or entered using coordinate geometry and adjusted to the surrounding existing linework. For updates, information from deeds and plats is used to digitize street centerlines within the mapped rights-of-way.

srcinfo.srccontr: digital cadastre used as a reference base for street centerline mapping.

citeinfo.title: Recorded deeds and plats of Wake County

srctime.srccurr: Approximate time period of deed recordation

srcinfo.srccontr: Official County records of reported property transactions including textural or graphic area delineations.

procstep.procdesc: Information was digitized 'heads-up' using the cadastral basemap as background reference with supplemental sources for street name, street type, and address information. The reference materials included recorded plats or deeds or existing mylar address overlays where no other information exists. All segments were digitized from intersection to intersection, one at a time, and attributed at the time of digitizing.

cntinfo.cntinst: Phone and electronic mail preferred. For current price information: http://www.wakegov.com/gis/gisdigitaldata.htm

procstep.procdesc: The portion of the streets within the City of Raleigh's planning jurisdiction was digitized by City of Raleigh staff. Wake County GIS furnished the City of Raleigh GIS with the application and all source code to accomplish primary input of streets in their jurisdiction, using the same prodedures and database design as Wake County. After completion of the project and quality control checks, the data was transferred to Wake County for long-term maintenance.

Information is digitized 'heads-up' using the cadastral basemap as background reference with supplemental sources for street name, street type, and address information. The reference materials include recorded plats or deeds. All segments are digitized from intersection to intersection, one at a time, and attributed at the time of digitizing. In the case of updates, the original segment is archived in the database, the new segment is added, and segment pointers in the database are updated.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: Street centerlines for all Wake County streets plus streets in Wake County municipalities that extend into adjacent counties

attr.attrdef: Length of segment in Feet calculated by ArcMap
Unique number representing centerline segments of the same street name and jurisdiction.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Enhanced Routing number representing chain of segments with similar elevation: 8,3,1
Enhanced Routing number representing chain of segments with similar elevation: 8,3,1
Unique Street Segment identifier - maintains relationship with GIS
Lowest address for segment on left side of street (Actual)
Highest address for segment on left side of street (Actual)
Lowest address for segment on right side of street (Actual)
Highest address for segment on right side of street (Actual)
Municipality (estimated) based on ownership of Right-of-Way - not adjacent property
One way designation: "FT" or "TF", "FT" traffic flows with address sequence, "TF" traffic flows against address sequence, "BI" = Bi-directional
Zip code name on Left side of street - used as the geocoding zone
Zip code name on Right side of street - used as the geocoding zone
Enhanced Routing - Travel time in minutes
Enhanced Routing - Travel time in minutes
Full Street Name for Enhanced Labeling - attributed only at strategic locations

edom.edomvd: Out of county but in a Wake County city

overview.eaover: A geodatabase feature class depicting the centerlines for all Wake County streets plus streets in Wake County municipalities that extend into adjacent counties.

cntinfo.cntinst: Phone and electronic mail preferred. For current price information: http://www.wakegov.com/gis/gisdigitaldata.htm

distinfo.distliab: Wake County GIS is charged with the development and maintenance of the County's corporate geographic database and, in cooperation with other mapping organizations, is committed to offering its users accurate, useful, and current information about the County. Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of information, errors and conditions originating from physical sources used to develop the database may be reflected in the data supplied. The user must be aware of data conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, original map scale, collection methodology, currency of data, and other conditions specific to certain data. The use of trade names or commercial products does not constitute their endorsement by the County.

digtinfo.filedec: Unzip using the latest version of WinZip (6.0 or higher) or other decompression software.

stdorder.fees: Selected datasets on CD in shapefile format are $100. For pricing on custom orders, see: http://www.wakegov.com/gis/gisdigitaldata.htm
stdorder.ordering: Selected datasets are available in Shape file format. All shapes are compressed into a zipped format and they include data only. Selected ata are also available in DXF format and are compressed using PKZIP. For more information, see: http://www.wakegov.com/gis/gisdigitaldata.htm

cntorgp.cntper: REQUIRED: The person responsible for the metadata information.

cntinfo.cntinst: Phone and electronic mail preferred. For current price information: http://www.wakegov.com/gis/gisdigitaldata.htm

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is to accompany the data set identified and received from WCGIS. WCGIS does not support secondary distribution. If this data file was received from anyone besides WCGIS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may contain discrepancies.
